poem:
Title: "Silenced Storm on Manhattan Shores"

A trumpeting beast struts through hallowed halls,
In gilt and glamour, shamed by tongues untamed.
"Locker room talk" – a gilded lie to cloak his fall,
A damaged ship - reputation, lashed and maimed.

Caught in the eye of a storm borne by a silent siren,
Borne of his actions, beyond brash words and bluster.
Only truth's harsh light can cleanse deceit's dark dyin',
End the charade, restore honor's lost luster.
